joehung302 wrote:
>>> What does 125M inserts mean? Does that mean I can have 125M URL 
>>> downloaded with 1 in 4M error rate? (that's about 30 dups in 125M?)
>> Yes -- it means that the predicted false-positive rate inherent to a 
>> bloom filter won't go over 1-in-4million (1 in 2^22) up through 
>> 125million inserts.
>>
>> (It will be even lower than that at the beginning, and even after 
>> 125million it won't rocket up, but edge up over that target error 
> rate 
>> over time.)
>>
> 
> Actually that might be good enough. My current idea is to have all 8 
> crawlers (total 8) download 1B pages in total. Assume ideal page 
> distribution (this is why a CHF-based CrawlMapper is much better than 
> the current alphabetical CrawlMapper), each crawler would be 
> responsible for 125M URLs.
> 
> Let's make sure we're not talking about "queue'ed" URLs 
> but "downloaded" URLs.
> 
> Please confirm. Thanks a lot,

Yes -- an URL is tested against (and inserted in) the already-included 
set just before it is queued/scheduled, not when it is downloaded.

- Gordon @ IA
